--- title: UQRUG 54 draft: false editor: visual date: '2024-09-25' description: '**Overview**: TidyTuesday + drop in session
**Questions**: spatial data; time series modelling; finance' categories: meeting toc: true toc-depth: 5 --- ## Topic: TidyTuesday Data for this week: ## Attendees Add your name, where you're from, and why you're here: | Name | Where are you from? | What brings you here? | |----|----|----| | Lina | SENV, PhD | Here to get used to R | | Jocelyn | Bioinformatics | | | Sam | | | | Gerry Katai | Master of Economics | | | Dawn | Master of Interaction Design | Here to find possibility of R, Newbie | | Man | PhD in oral health | Here to get used to R | | Prakash | Master of Commerce - Accounting and Finance | | | David Green | RCC | | | St√©phane | Library | Here to help | | Luke | Library | Here to attempt to help | ## Questions and resources shared R for spatial data: - ggplot2 has coordinate systems for maps too (with `coord_sf()`) - To process vector data: sf - To process raster data: terra - tmap for static and interactive visualisations: - Book: - CRAN task view on spatial: - ROpenSci gives access to packages for spatial processing and data downloads: - Example of acquiring OSM data, using sf and sfnetworks for spatial networks, and tmap for an interactive visualisation: Spatial data sources: - for example for Digital Elevation Model (DEM), there's SRTM - - Community of practice for spatial stuff: Resources for (time series) modelling: - which works hand-in-hand with - `arima()` in core R (stats package) - time series modeling with tidymodels: - Training session for time series: Finance: - - example of Tesla stocks over-inflated - Financial modelling and stock analysis: - Collection of econometric functions for performance and risk analysis: - Thorough resource about Using R for Predictive Modeling in Finance:
